name: Bayan Islamic Graduate School
mission: Offer a world-class non-sectarian education and produce dynamic, ethical leaders and scholars grounded in the Islamic tradition.
programs: Master's of Divinity in Islamic Chaplaincy
theoryOfChange: By bridging Islamic tradition with modern context through accredited graduate education, Bayan produces ethical leaders who uplift communities and provide professional spiritual care.

evaluationSources: Accredited via partners Chicago Theological Seminary (ATS and HLC)

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Bayan earns 58/100 due to good impact and good alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: Bayan holds a Charity Navigator score of 86.25/100 and holds 6.7 months of working capital.
The organization reported total revenue of $3,153,900 and a program expense ratio of 52.0%.
Bayan offers Master's degrees in Religious Studies, Islamic Chaplaincy, and Islamic Theological Studies.
The organization provides various methods for donors to contribute charitable gifts and sadaqah.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Bayan earns a moderate overall rating due to its specialized educational impact and high data confidence, though its financial efficiency metrics and program spending ratio limit its total score.
areas_for_improvement: The program expense ratio of 52.0% suggests a significant portion of funds is directed toward administrative or fundraising costs.
Fundraising efficiency stands at $0.29 per $1 raised, which presents an opportunity for cost optimization in donor acquisition.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows medium alignment for donors interested in global education and leadership development, offering various sadaqah-eligible giving options to support its mission [3][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: Bayan focuses on capacity building within the American Muslim community by training religious leaders, though its high cost per beneficiary and a program expense ratio of 52.0% reflect the resource-intensive nature of higher education [1][2][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Bayan provides world-class non-sectarian education to develop ethical leaders and scholars grounded in the Islamic tradition.
strengths: Maintains a strong Charity Navigator score of 86.25/100, indicating high levels of accountability and transparency.
Offers diverse academic pathways including Islamic Theological Studies and professional chaplaincy training.
baseline_narrative.summary: Operating as a specialized higher education institution, Bayan offers advanced degrees including a Master's in Religious Studies and a Master of Divinity in Islamic Chaplaincy [3]. The organization reported a total revenue of $3,153,900 and maintains a solid financial standing with 6.7 months of working capital [1][2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Bayan earns a moderate overall rating due to its specialized educational impact and high data confidence, though its financial efficiency metrics and program spending ratio limit its total score.

It costs the organization <cite id="1">$0.29 to raise every $1</cite>, which is higher than top-performing efficiency benchmarks.

bbb_assessment.summary: Bayan is not currently rated by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The school maintains a high <cite id="1">working capital ratio of 7.2 months</cite>, mitigating short-term financial risks.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">Accountability score of 86/100</cite> suggests gaps in public documentation or specific financial policies.
case_against.summary: The primary concern for donors is the <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 52.0%</cite>, which indicates that over a third of the budget is spent on non-programmatic costs.

confidence.data_freshness: Data from 2023 tax year and 2024 ratings
confidence.notes: Strong alignment between financial filings and third-party ratings.

alignment.explanation: The organization has a <cite id="3">strong Islamic identity</cite> and serves the 'fisabilillah' category, making it a good fit for Muslim donors seeking to support education.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be enhanced by <cite id="4">adding a dedicated giving page</cite> that highlights the humanitarian dimensions of its educational work.

credibility.explanation: Bayan is a highly credible institution holding a <cite id="1">Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a <cite id="1">86.25/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization could <cite id="1">improve its accountability beacon score</cite> which currently stands at 56.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a capacity-building model with a <cite id="1">cost per beneficiary of $20,026.38</cite>, typical for high-level graduate education.
impact.improvement: The school could improve its impact score by <cite id="1">documenting a clear theory of change</cite> with a defined causal pathway.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes with developing theory of change

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value the long-term intellectual and leadership development of the American Muslim community through accredited higher education.
donor_motivations: Want to support the professionalization of Islamic chaplaincy
Value academic rigor and non-sectarian Islamic scholarship
Prefer investing in institutional infrastructure over direct emergency relief
Interested in 'fisabilillah' (in the path of God) charitable giving
giving_considerations: High cost-per-student is standard for graduate-level education
A significant portion of revenue is generated through tuition
Focus is on domestic US leadership rather than international aid
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-volume, low-cost humanitarian interventions or those requiring a high program-to-overhead ratio.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The institution has <cite id="1">verified evidence and outcomes</cite>, though its causal pathway documentation is still developing.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Bayan creates impact by training scholars and leaders who then influence thousands within their respective communities and professional fields.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that graduate education translates into effective community leadership and spiritual care.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a growing graduate school, Bayan has a significant funding gap to expand its faculty and scholarship offerings.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="3">non-sectarian approach</cite> to Islamic graduate studies in a US context.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains high governance standards with a <cite id="1">perfect 100/100 score in both Culture and Leadership</cite> from Charity Navigator.
Bayan offers specialized professional training including <cite id="3">Islamic Chaplaincy and Islamic Education</cite> to meet the needs of the American Muslim community.
The school maintains <cite id="1">6.7 months of working capital</cite>, providing a strong buffer for long-term operational stability.

strengths_deep_dive: Bayan's organizational strength is rooted in its robust governance structure, featuring an <cite id="1">independent board membership of 87%</cite>. This level of oversight contributes to its <cite id="1">overall score of 86.25/100</cite> from Charity Navigator, signaling a high level of transparency. Furthermore, the institution has successfully diversified its impact by offering a <cite id="3">Doctor of Ministry (DMin)</cite> program, which allows for advanced professional development in religious leadership. The school's ability to maintain <cite id="2">total assets of $1,949,004</cite> against relatively low liabilities of <cite id="2">$281,460</cite> demonstrates a disciplined approach to financial management during its growth phase.
rich_narrative.summary: Bayan Islamic Graduate School, <cite id="1">founded in 2011</cite>, serves as a pioneering higher education institution dedicated to developing ethical leaders and scholars grounded in the Islamic tradition. Operating in the United States, the school provides a <cite id="3">non-sectarian academic environment</cite> that bridges traditional Islamic knowledge with contemporary professional needs. The organization reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $3,153,900</cite> in the 2023 tax year, reflecting a stable financial base for its specialized educational mission. Bayan's academic portfolio is diverse, offering <cite id="3">Master of Arts degrees in Islamic Theological Studies, Islamic Education, and Organizational Leadership</cite>, alongside a <cite id="3">Master of Divinity in Islamic Chaplaincy</cite> and a Doctor of Ministry. These programs are designed to equip students for roles in community leadership, education, and spiritual care. While the school maintains a <cite id="1">Charity Navigator score of 86.25/100</cite>, its financial model is unique among non-profits, generating <cite id="2">$1,432,214 in program service revenue</cite>, which indicates a significant reliance on tuition and academic fees alongside charitable contributions of <cite id="2">$1,034,092</cite>. This hybrid revenue model supports its capacity-building delivery method, though it results in a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 52.0%</cite>, which is lower than the peer median for global education charities.
